reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I planned a romantic get-away to the West Baden Springs hotel for a Saturday evening. The drive to the hotel (we live a few hours north of West Baden) was beautiful this time of year, and we stopped at several antique stores along the way to poke around. The French Lick Village Market antique mall was very fun with a quirky mix of new items and antiques. Found a beautiful candelabra there! Check in at West Baden was easy and the room was exactly as described here and on the hotel website. Couldn't find any pictures of the bathrooms so have posted those here. Slightly disappointed that the bathroom had no soaking tub, for a room of this price I would expect at least a soaking tub, if not a jetted tub. Room service for dinner and breakfast was fast and the food was delicious. Gambled a little in the casino at French Lick, the reviewers on here are correct that it is very smokey and a shame that the ventilation isn't better equipped. I've been to Las Vegas numerous times and the casinos there were never this smokey (at least not on the strip, some of the downtown casinos could get pretty bad). The designated nonsmoking gambling room was great and much more comfortable for our lungs. The history of both hotels is amazing, and we wished we had more time for the guided tours as we had lots of questions about both resorts once we were able to walk around and enjoy the surroundings. Shuttle was no problem and fast between both resorts, we used it twice, once early in the evening, and once about 2:00am, and both times no long waits. Had drinks in the lounge at West Baden and enjoyed the live band, very fun people watching, many dressed for halloween. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Romance and History

reviews.text: Great hotel! Staff very friendly and helpful. Food was excellent. Wish I could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Fall at West Baden Springs Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I grew up in French Lick, and hadn't been back to visit in 20 years. My husband and I recently stayed in the West Baden Hotel and it was fabulous! Amazingly beautiful, delicious food, professional staff - and the spa was heavenly! We are now planning to return each year to celebrate the incredible restoration of this magnificent resort. We couldn't have been more pleased.
reviews.title: Fabulous Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a frequent traveler and have stayed in many beautiful hotels. This one would have to be in my top five favorites!
reviews.title: Classic Hotel but Not All it Could Be

reviews.text: This hotel is a classic of a bygone era but total restoration still seems to be a work in progress. First, the domed atrium is beautiful and huge. It's one of the main draws and it is nice to just relax in and stare up at the ceiling. The interior of the property is very well maintained. There are lots of rocking chairs on the verandas to help you enjoy the peaceful surroundings. However, the grounds were underwhelming. They are large, but the landscaping is nothing special and there's not much in the way of flowers or interesting plants. It looks like they are still working on some of the buildings in the garden areas.
reviews.title: A world class hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the West Baden Springs Hotel in southern Indiana again, and will be back for a conference for another entity next week. The building is stunning, rooms are spacious and sumptiously appointed, the restaurants excellent.
reviews.title: Spectacular as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to West Baden for our first anniversary. We purchased the In the Mood for Love package. It included a couples' aromatherapy massage, $100 toward dinner at Sinclair's Ristorante, and a one night stay in a king room. We had an absolutely wonderful time. The spa is beautiful and luxurious. The massage was great. Everything we ate was delicious. The dinner we had at Sinclair's was one of the best meals we have ever eaten. If you're celebrating something special, I would definitely recommend West Baden (as it is a bit pricey, but completely worth it!).
reviews.title: West Baden anniversary trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was friendly and courteous. Shuttle is an excellent way to travel around the resort, parked the car on Friday and did not need it until we left on Sunday. Internet access without charge is a nice touch--too many upscale hotels are charging outrageous fees for the service to increase their profits. It is very relaxing to lounge in the central atrium with a book.
reviews.title: 5th stay still excellent

reviews.text: Food in Sinclairs is a bit pricey, but very well prepared. The wait staff were very friendly in spite of being over worked. Only negative comment is the many tables left with dirty dishes after guests left due to dining management failing to have tables bussed in a timely fashion.
reviews.title: Simply has everything for everyone. Golden Age renewed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being off the beaten path is part of the charm. I would add a couple of lounge chairs in the dome since they were always filled. We shall certainly return again.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The story behind the renovation alone is worth the trip! This is definitely a jewel in southern Indiana. The drive over, from any direction, the last 1/2 hour is lovely. This is as good as any luxury hotel I have ever stayed in Europe. It is expensive...but you will understand why. By all means..if you can afford it you must dine at TABLE ONE. If you can muster up 8 people together you can do it for as little as roughly $150 per person. It is an experience you will never forget. Quite unique! Wander the grounds and study the interior...it will take you several hours. For entertainment the neighboring French Lick Resort has a Casino and a bowling alley, on occasion entertainment as well. This Hotel is restful, quiet and elegant. It is absolutely NOT for the frugal. If you have to ask...you can not afford it.
reviews.title: You gotta see this!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I traveled to West Baden for our anniversary. The hotel is gorgeous. You cannot describe the atrium's beauty and it's not just the atrium. The spa, restaurant and grounds are unbelievable. It's amazing this place is in southern Indiana. We explored the entire hotel including the shopping and it was wonderful. We ate at Sinclair's and although it was pricey... it was fabulous. I had the Ahi tuna and it was done perfectly. The service in the restaurant and bar were excellent. Our room was on the outside of the hotel. It was near the service elevators but it was very quiet. The room was very clean and decorated very well. The bathroom had beautiful tile and granite.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel... staff was a bit snooty

reviews.text: Having said all of that.... we did have some interesting experiences with the some of the staff. We were met at the door by what proved to be some very pushy bellmen. We were instructed to move our car right in front of the door knowing we were going to be inside for a more than a few minutes checking in. We were there to bike ride and the bikes were in the car. Valet parking was not going to work for us as we needed access to the car and bikes later in the afternoon. The bellmen seemed to take offense that we were not valet parking. He also was rude about how long it was sitting there when we were clear we were checking in.... Later we witnessed a bellman telling motorcylists that they could not park in the self park area due to liability when there were no signs indicating there was special motorcycle parking. It was very rude and offensive to all who saw this incident. The staff at the front desk was also snooty to us at check in and at check out. When we questioned the bill, they could not explain it very well and it was incorrect when we first received it. We purchased a package and it was apparently complicated to figure out. The staff acted like we were an inconvience during this episode, but when you are spending the amount of money they charge, you want to make sure the bill is correct.
reviews.title: Lovely Overnight Stay!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is unbelievable but we definately got the impression that the staff knew this and didn't need to work to gain loyalty of new customers. I am still considering taking a large group of women friends there for an overnight trip. I plan to warn everyone just so they aren't surprised. I have stayed at other very nice places in large cities and I think this hotel could really reach full potential if ALL of the staff tried to welcome all guests and not just those that valet park or don't ask questions.
reviews.title: Golf great, a little disappointed with hotel

reviews.text: My best friend and I stayed overnight at the West Baden on our way to Louisville from Indianapolis. We wanted a little special detour for our girls' weekend and wanted to see French Lick and experience the West Baden, after all we'd heard. We had a wonderful time! The hotel is beautiful, the history is amazing and not to be missed, and the architecture is something to appreciate. What an historical restoration! Our room looked into the atrium, was beautifully decorated in what we called celadon green, silvers, and muted golds. Our two queen beds were so soft and cozy we could hardly crawl out in the morning and laughed how lazy we were not moving in bed. Our bathroom was large, granite everywhere, thick, large terry towels, luxurious robes, and lots of amenities! The food was excellent at Sinclair's for dinner and at the Sinclair's Cafe for breakfast.
reviews.title: A Gem in the Hills of Indiana

reviews.text: Walking into the enormous lobby/domed cathedral one is totally blown away with the majestic sights. The hotel has been lovingly and truthfully restored to its glorious past magnificence. We were invited to afternoon tea by friends who were celebrating one of the spouse's birthday..We were seated in an area in the lobby and were able to admire pretty much everything. The wait staff brought English style sandwiches and trays of tea samples. We were to indicate our choice after which they brought 3 pots of our favorites. Unfortunately the tea pots were not marked so after the first cup we were reduced to guessing which is which tea. The wait staff were pretty average--we could tell they were anxious for us to leave..So the bottom line is: go for tea in the early afternoon not late and ask them to place stickers or some identification on the tea pots for those times when the wait staff were not around to pour. We don't know how much the tea party cost but we had a good time with friends in the gorgeous facility
reviews.title: Full disclosure: we did not stay at the hotel but went there for afternoon tea.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is truly a hidden treasure tucked deep in the heartland. This turn of the century hotel, although recently remodled, retains alot of the charm of the early 1900s. The domed attrium is unlike anything you will ever see. The rooms are wonderful, quiet and the hotel is VERY clean. Make use of the spa!! The Mineral bath is one of the most relaxing things I have ever done. Also highly recommend the Horseback riding. The Casino, attached to the neighboring French Lick resort, is nice but smokey. I also recommend having dinner at the 1875 Steak House at the French Lick resort (get reservations). The food was excellent. All in all, this is a GREAT place for a couples get away. Kids might be a little bored!
reviews.title: Wonderful place to get away and relax

reviews.text: Went to West Bayden for a two-night getaway with my husband and adult son. What a pleasant surprise! Have stayed at many five-star hotels, and West Bayden can hold a candle to any of them. The food was delicious, the service was excellent and the staff was most courteous. The attention to detail in the renovation of this historic building is evident throughout the facility. From the fabrics, furniture, accessories, nothing was sacrificed. The hotel was redone in the style for which it was intended but outfitted with current amenities. Kudos to the Cook family for saving this jewel for all of us to enjoy. We definitely will recommend West Bayden to our friends and hope to return in the near future.
reviews.title: Marion S. -- Great Vacation Getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had been hearing for years how nice French Lick Resort is and had been wanting to go for some time. I had a rough year health-wise so we decided this was the year to treat ourselves. I went online to decide which hotel to stay at, French Lick or West Baden. They both looked nice, but we decided the spa at West Baden suited us better, and the idea of a gardenview room appealed to us.
reviews.title: West Baden Springs Vacation First Rate

reviews.text: We could not have been more satisfied! The reservation clerks were all most hepful! Gary helped us put together a nice package inclduing one night of the Summer Picnic Package with a lovely wicker basket, treats and a darling bear in a West Baden outfit! Our room was lovely, the housekeepers were very efficient and receptive to our requests. The atrium is FABULOUS! The bellcaps and concierges were all very helpful and informational, especially Ray. We enjoyed our breakfasts at Cafe Sinclair, the preparation, and presentation impeccable, every dish tasty and visually appealing, the wait staff all very nice, especially Pattie and a nice young man from Jamaica. We enjoyed a light tasty diner at Ballards, the waitress being very accomodating to our requests.
reviews.title: Great place for honeymoon for the 50 something!
